historySnippet.reasoning: A is already far above the 0.75 objective but is fading while D is collapsing; since the best record was achieved at U=0.10 with near-identical params and recent k_A_decay tweaks tended to hurt (e.g., Gen 4281/4385/4419), we keep U at the proven level and reduce diversity-collapse pressure by lowering k_D_decay while leaving k_DU unchanged per rule 3.

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising, but Diversity is starting to collapse (dD/dt=-0.0122), so keep U at the best-record level while easing diversity decay pressure by lowering k_D_decay (recent small k_D_decay tweaks slightly improved A) and minimally reducing k_DU to preserve exploration without destabilizing A.

Agency is already safely above 0.75 and still rising, but C and especially D are decaying, so I’ll keep U at the best-record level while reducing diversity collapse pressure (lower k_D_decay) and slightly boosting diversity-driven complexity (k_CD) to stabilize long-run agency without destabilizing A (recent k_D_decay tweaks were mixed, so make a small corrective move rather than a phase shift).

A is already safely above 0.75 and slightly rising, but C is drifting down (dC/dt<0) so I’ll apply a mild “challenge” increase in U while keeping params close to the best record (which already achieved A=1.0 at U=0.10) and avoid risky decay/selection changes given recent mixed impacts from k_D_decay/k_A_decay tweaks.

Agency is already well above the 0.75 threshold and still rising; since the best record occurred at lower U=0.10 and the most recent k_U increase didn’t help, revert U toward the best while keeping parameters stable to preserve the high-A attractor.

Agency is already safely >0.75 and still increasing; since the best record (A=1.0) occurred near U=0.10 with very similar params, I’ll nudge U slightly down toward that optimum while keeping the current high-stimulation coefficients stable to avoid the past k_D_decay/k_A_decay swings that sometimes reduced A.

Agency is already well above the 0.75 target and still rising (dA/dt>0) while complexity is slowly decaying, so I’ll keep U at the best-record level (0.10) and slightly boost complexity retention and diversity-to-complexity transfer to stabilize C without adding extra selection pressure (noting prior U=0.11 reduced A).

Agency is already safely above 0.75 and still rising (dA/dt>0) with U matching the best-record setting, so I’ll take a controlled “challenge” step by nudging U upward while slightly reducing k_A_decay to sustain A (prior U increase helped at Gen 4662.9, whereas larger U=0.11 caused a small dip at Gen 4699.4).

Agency is already very high and still rising; since best record hit A=1.0 at U=0.10 and we’re currently slightly above that (avg U=0.12) with some recent parameter tweaks causing small regressions, revert U toward the best and reduce A decay a notch to lock in and push toward saturation.

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising (dA/dt=0.0030) at essentially the best-record U=0.10, so I’ll keep U stable while slightly reducing k_A_decay to sustain near-saturation without destabilizing C/D (recent k_U and k_D_decay tweaks were mixed).

name: Micro-Difficulty Homeostat
description: This agent crossed the Agency Threshold by tightly regulating environmental pressure (k_U=0.38, k_AU=1) while keeping internal volatility low (sigma_A=0.005, sigma_C=0.005) and preserving strong diversity (D=0.961). Its emergence was catalyzed by a sequence where tuning cross-couplings (k_CD=0.5, k_AC=0.49) and reducing complexity decay (k_C_decay=0.1) produced a sustained agency lift, even after a difficulty uptick (U raised to 0.11) temporarily knocked agency down—followed by recovery when k_U and k_A_decay were rebalanced.
